Conduct an air rifle activity

All RSO in the CAF conduct range activities following the same proven process.

The safe conduct of a range activity requires a systematic approach by the RSO to informing and preparing participants for the planned activity, and then controlling the actions of people and the movement of rifles and equipment on the range.

 

Every range activity will follow the same basic process – all participants attend a range briefing and any new participants are assessed to be sure they can handle a rifle safely; then each stage of the activity is controlled by the RSO giving the appropriate range command, and should an emergency occur, the RSO ensures first aid is carried out and refers to the Emergency Response Plan if needed.
